intro: Ficus kitubalu, commonly known as the African rubber fig, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Moraceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by figs that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, warm environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. The tree can grow quite tall, reaching up to 15 meters in height in its natural habitat.
